meanings.definition: A very small drop of a liquid
meanings.sent1: The rain formed tiny droplets on the window.
meanings.sent2: She sprayed perfume, and droplets of the scent lingered in the air.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous toddler pretended the droplets were magical fairy tears.
meanings.sent4: The morning dew glistened like droplets of liquid diamonds on the grass.
meanings.sent5: The scientist observed the droplets under the microscope, marveling at their minuscule size.

meanings.sent1: He added a few droplets of lemon juice to the recipe for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: There were only droplets of paint left in the can.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that a droplet of coffee was enough to wake him up in the morning.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like droplets of sunshine in a gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The student carefully measured each droplet of ink before starting the calligraphy project.
